intro: Psilocaulon subintegrum, commonly known as the smooth-surfaced psilocaulon, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids, and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often near streams or in dense forest undergrowth. Its leaves are smooth and waxy, and it produces fragrant, pale yellow or white blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
